key_points: A house fire in Sugar Land, Texas, during a winter storm claimed the lives of three children and their grandmother.
Survived by Jackie Pham Nguyen, the mother of the children, and her friend Mai Bui, both of whom suffered major burns.
The fire occurred on Feb. 16, with Sugar Land Fire Department responding around 2:15 a.m.
Nguyen's mother, Loan Le, was also in the house because her own power had gone out.
The family used the fireplace for warmth due to power outages, which is under investigation as a possible cause of the fire.
Doug Adolph, a spokesperson for the city, mentioned the uncertainty of determining the fire's exact cause.
Jackie Pham Nguyen described her children and mother with deep affection and highlighted their individual interests and achievements.
Two GoFundMe campaigns have been set up to honor Nguyen's children, supporting various charities and raising awareness for fire safety.
Proceeds will also provide tuition assistance at St. Laurence Catholic School, the children's school, and help raise fire safety awareness.
Jackie Pham Nguyen expressed gratitude for the support and kindness received following the tragedy.
spokespersons: Doug Adolph (Spokesperson, City of Sugar Land)
